intro: Verbascum phoeniceum var. villosum, commonly known as the silky mullein, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems covered in dense, soft, silky hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a similar fuzzy texture, contributing to its overall ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and natural habitats.
